DataElement.preferredName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Imaging Procedure Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The imaging procedure used to determine how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Imaging Technique Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An image of the heart produced by ultrasonography.

Concepts.definition: An image of the heart produced by ultrasonography.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A multi-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan and a form of radionuclide imaging that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic test used to evaluate the pumping function of the heart's ventricles. A radioactive tracer is injected into a vein and a gamma camera detects the radiation released by the tracer, with image acquisition triggered (gated) at different points of the cardiac cycle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
